title: Financial Planning and Analysis Manager
description:
Job Title: Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)
Location: Nationwide (Remote work with hybrid travel to corporate HQ every quarter)
East 57th Street Partners is on the search for a highly skilled and analytical Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) for one of our distinguished clients. This essential role is tailored for a finance professional with extensive experience in financial forecasting, budgeting, and strategic analysis. The Manager of FP&A will spearhead the financial planning and analysis operations, offering strategic insights to facilitate decision-making and propel business growth. This position is remote, complemented by hybrid travel requirements to the corporate headquarters each quarter.
Role Summary:The Manager of FP&A will oversee the company's financial planning and analysis functions, including the orchestration of budgeting, forecasting, and analytical support to enhance strategic decision-making. The role demands effective collaboration with senior management to develop financial models, perform variance analyses, and deliver strategic insights that drive the financial and operational strategies of the company.
Key Responsibilities:Lead the annual budgeting and regular forecasting processes, ensuring precision, timeliness, and strategic alignment.Create and maintain sophisticated financial models to support decisions on strategic initiatives, capital investments, and operational enhancements.Perform comprehensive financial analyses, including variance and trend analyses, evaluating financial performance against key business metrics.Offer actionable insights and recommendations to senior management based on meticulous financial analysis and projections.Manage the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, encompassing executive dashboards and detailed financial analyses.Work closely with business unit leaders to pinpoint financial opportunities and challenges, aiding in the attainment of their financial goals.Direct special projects aimed at financial systems enhancements, process optimization, and other initiatives to boost the FP&A function's efficiency and impact.Supervise and develop a team of financial analysts, nurturing a culture of continuous improvement and professional development.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field; MBA or relevant professional certification (e.g., CFA, CPA) strongly preferred.At least 5-7 years of experience in financial planning and analysis, with demonstrated success in guiding budgeting and forecasting activities and providing strategic financial insights.Expertise in analytical and financial modeling skills, proficient in Excel and financial planning software.Exceptional communication and presentation abilities, adept at explaining complex financial information to non-financial audiences.Proven leadership qualities, with experience in team management and cross-functional collaboration.Capability to operate independently in a remote setting, with exceptional organizational skills and the capacity to juggle multiple tasks.Preparedness to travel to the corporate headquarters quarterly for strategic engagements and team collaboration.Compensation:Base salary: $120,000 to $140,000, based on experience and qualifications.Bonus: 15% of base salary, contingent on company and individual performance metrics.Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance, a retirement savings plan, and generous vacation and personal leave policies.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Family-owned for over 40 years, DMSi is a software development company in Omaha, NE, focused on delivering industry-leading ERP applications to our customers across the United States. Our Business Analysts are instrumental to our development team, translating customer/market needs into software solutions. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a skilled Business Analyst who enjoys a challenge every day to help develop solutions within a cross-functional, Agile development team.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:Write concise and compelling user stories. Define user story acceptance criteria for developers, quality analysts, and product owners to ensure that the product owners’ intent is effectively captured. Collaborate with customers, stakeholders, product owners, architecture, and design teams to discover, define, and design features to meet user needs and enhance the user experience.Gather requirements through various methods, including customer interviews, questionnaires, surveys, workflow, process analysis, observation, and other methods. Distinguish user requests from user needs.Actively engage in all aspects of an Agile development team, including planning, retrospecting, product demonstrations, and daily stand-ups.Collaborate with the product owner to understand and share product goals and vision within the team.Develop expert knowledge of our customer base, industry, and products.Arrange and perform user acceptance testing or customer reviews with internal and external stakeholders.Review test plans to verify they meet the acceptance criteria and intent of user stories.Write or review supporting documentation for the software, such as release notes, help documentation, articles, and features.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: Excellent listening, written, and oral communication skills.Cross-functional member of Agile development team.Expert knowledge of decomposing product needs to agile user stories.Ability to facilitate customer interviews.Strong knowledge and application of Agile methodology.Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving abilities.Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.Superior presentation and negotiation skills; able to exercise independent judgment.Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.Strong adaptability and capacity to work on multiple projects.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business Analysis, Business Administration, MIS, or related fields.Two to five years of Business Analyst experience.Strong background in software development lifecycle, project management, and business analyst best practices.
WORK ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Normal office environment with use of computers and telephone systems; no unusual physical demands.Ability to travel as needed, including rental car and air flight.

title: Superintendent - Multifamily - Atlanta
description:
Superintendent - Multifamily Project - Atlanta, Georgia. 
Overview: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Superintendent specializing in stick frame multifamily projects. The Superintendent will oversee all aspects of construction operations, ensuring that this excellent project is completed safely, on schedule, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of delivering ground up Multifamily Projects and possess strong leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
Responsibilities:
Project Management:Manage all aspects of stick frame wrap construction projects from inception to completion, including scheduling, budgeting, subcontractor coordination, and quality control.
Team Leadership:Provide leadership and guidance to project teams, subcontractors, and site personnel, fostering a culture of safety, collaboration, and accountability.
Schedule and Budget Control:Develop and maintain project schedules and budgets, monitor progress, and implement corrective measures as needed to ensure projects are completed on time and within budget.
Quality Assurance:Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure that workmanship and materials meet or exceed project specifications and industry standards.
Safety Compliance:Enforce strict adherence to safety protocols and regulations, conducting regular safety inspections, and addressing any safety concerns promptly to maintain a safe working environment for all personnel.
Client Relations:Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, addressing their concerns, providing regular project updates, and ensuring their satisfaction throughout the construction process.
Problem Solving:Identify potential challenges or obstacles and develop proactive solutions to mitigate risks and keep projects on track.
Documentation and Reporting:Maintain accurate and detailed project documentation, including daily reports, progress photos, and meeting minutes, and provide regular progress reports to project stakeholders.
Subcontractor Management:Coordinate with subcontractors and vendors, overseeing their work performance, resolving conflicts, and ensuring compliance with project requirements.
Continuous Improvement:Stay abreast of industry best practices, emerging technologies, and construction trends, and incorporate innovative solutions to improve project efficiency and quality.
Qualifications:

Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in Wood Frame construction, with a proven track record of successfully managing projects from start to finish.Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and techniques, particularly related to stick frame wrap construction.Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively manage and motivate project teams.Proficiency in project management software and tools, such as Procore, Primavera P6, or Microsoft Project.OSHA 30-Hour Construction Safety Certification (preferred).Ability to travel to project sites and work flexible hours as needed to meet project deadlines.Valid driver's license and reliable transportation.

title: Private Equity Operating Partner
description:
Job Title: Private Equity Operating Partner
East 57th Street Partners is actively seeking a seasoned Private Equity Operating Partner on behalf of one of our esteemed private equity clients. This pivotal role is designed for a highly experienced executive with a proven track record in driving value creation, operational improvements, and strategic growth within portfolio companies. The Operating Partner will work closely with the private equity team and the leadership of portfolio companies to implement best practices, achieve operational excellence, and execute growth strategies.
Role Summary:The Private Equity Operating Partner will be instrumental in identifying and executing on opportunities for operational improvement and strategic growth across the portfolio. This role requires a blend of strategic vision, operational expertise, and the ability to work effectively with management teams at portfolio companies. The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of industry trends, competitive dynamics, and value creation levers that can drive significant returns on investment.
Key Responsibilities:Collaborate with investment teams to conduct due diligence on potential investments, focusing on operational capabilities, growth opportunities, and potential synergies.Develop and implement strategic plans for portfolio companies, including operational improvements, market expansion, and organizational development.Serve as a key advisor to CEOs and management teams of portfolio companies, providing expertise and guidance on business transformation and best practices.Drive performance improvement initiatives across portfolio companies, leveraging data analytics, process reengineering, and technology enhancements.Monitor and evaluate the performance of portfolio companies against operational and financial metrics, identifying areas for improvement.Facilitate knowledge sharing and best practices across the portfolio, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.Support portfolio companies in M&A activities, including due diligence, integration planning, and post-merger integration execution.Contribute to the overall strategy of the private equity firm, including sector focus, investment thesis development, and portfolio construction.Qualifications:Extensive experience in senior executive roles, preferably with a strong background in operational leadership, consulting, or private equity.Proven track record of driving operational improvements, strategic growth, and value creation within complex organizations.Deep understanding of financial analysis, business strategy, and market dynamics.Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and work collaboratively with CEOs and management teams.Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.Flexibility to travel extensively and work across various industries and geographic locations.Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, or related field; title: Universal Banker
description:
Leader Bank is looking for exceptionally dedicated team members to join one of the region’s fastest growing community banks and mortgage lenders. At the time of its founding in 2002, Leader Bank had one branch office, $6.5 million in assets and 7 team members. Since then, the Bank has become of the most successful banks in Massachusetts with more than $4 billion in assets, more than 400 team members, 7 branch offices, and annual mortgage originations of over $5 billion.
Exemplary products and an innovative spirit have driven Leader Bank’s rapid growth over the years, and our team members embrace these values. Our mission is to obsess over our clients, make them feel valued, and maintain long-term relationships with them by constantly enhancing our products and processes to always be improving our client experience. For our team members, Leader Bank prioritizes competitive compensation and benefits, a healthy work-life balance, and an environment that fosters diversity and inclusion.
 Essential Duties
Maintains a high level of understanding of all products and services provided by the Bank.Maintains a high level of service quality by acknowledging the customer’s presence through a professional greeting and developing an interpersonal relationship built upon an understanding of customer needs. Conveys to customers an eagerness / willingness to help.Performs as a teller including performing financial transactions with Bank customers and settlement procedures and balances cash drawer, as needed.Meets customer needs through problem solving techniques as required.Sells and refers Bank products and services within the guidelines established by the Bank. Follows up with prospects by asking for their business. Maintains referral documentation and actively participates in sales promotions.Conducts business in a professional manner and maintains a neat and orderly work area.Establishes and maintains a good working relationship with all Bank team members.Participates in community projects and organizations as requested. Demonstrates a willingness to accept added duties and responsibilities.Performs all banking transactions, including opening accounts, checking & savings deposits, IRA’s, business retirement accounts, and various types of payments, in accordance with Bank policy.Understands and adheres to security, compliance, and retail banking policies and procedures.Comply with all aspects of the Bank Secrecy Act responsibilities include accurately completing Currency Transaction Reports (CTRs), adhering to the Customer Identification Program (CIP) Policy, reporting suspicious activity to your manager, and performing Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) checks.Performs other duties as may be required from time to time by management. 
Qualifications
High School Diploma or equivalentA minimum of two years retail banking experience or retail sales and service experienceStrong interpersonal skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsGeneral personal computer knowledge, prior experience banking applications preferredAbility to handle multiple priorities and poses a strong attention to detailSales and service oriented personalityMust be available to work Saturdays and evenings on a rotating basis 
Leader Bank offers an excellent compensation and benefits package including: 401k plan with corporate match, medical and dental insurance, and the opportunity to work for a fast growing, local organization.
Leader Bank, N.A. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, military status, veteran status or any other protected class.

title: Senior Associate, Private Equity
description:
Job Title: Senior Associate, Private Equity
East 57th Street Partners is on the lookout for a talented and ambitious Senior Associate, Private Equity on behalf of one of our premier private equity clients. This role is designed for a finance professional who demonstrates a strong track record in financial analysis, deal execution, and portfolio management within the private equity sector. The Senior Associate will play a crucial role in evaluating investment opportunities, executing transactions, and supporting the active management of portfolio companies to drive growth and value creation.
Role Summary:The Senior Associate, Private Equity will be an integral part of the investment team, contributing to all aspects of the investment process from origination to exit. This includes conducting market research, financial modeling, due diligence, deal structuring, and portfolio company oversight. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of financial markets, strong analytical skills, and the ability to work collaboratively within a team environment.
Key Responsibilities:Conduct detailed financial analysis and modeling to evaluate investment opportunities, including analyzing company financials, building LBO models, and assessing potential returns.Participate in the due diligence process, coordinating with external advisors and internal teams to assess the financial, operational, and strategic aspects of target companies.Assist in the preparation of investment memoranda and presentations for the investment committee, providing comprehensive overviews of investment rationale, deal structure, and expected outcomes.Support the deal execution process, working closely with legal, financial, and operational advisors to ensure smooth transaction closings.Monitor the performance of portfolio companies, working with management teams to implement strategic initiatives, operational improvements, and prepare for exit strategies.Contribute to the firm’s portfolio management efforts, including quarterly reporting, valuation analysis, and investment performance tracking.Engage in market research and industry analysis to identify trends, investment themes, and potential targets within preferred sectors.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field; MBA or relevant graduate degree is highly preferred.Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in private equity, investment banking, or management consulting, with a proven track record in financial modeling and analysis.Strong analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to conduct thorough financial analysis and valuations.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of effectively collaborating with team members, portfolio company management, and external partners.Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work under pressure to meet deadlines.High level of initiative and self-motivation, with a strong desire to contribute to the success of the team and the firm.Willingness to travel as needed for deal execution and portfolio company oversight.Benefits:Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.Opportunity to work with a dynamic team of investment professionals in a leading private equity firm.Exposure to a diverse range of industries and investment strategies, offering significant professional growth and development opportunities.Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.Retirement savings plan with company contribution.Generous vacation and personal leave policies.

title: Chief Executive Officer
description:
Job Title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO)
East 57th Street Partners is currently seeking an exceptional Chief Executive Officer (CEO) on behalf of one of our distinguished clients. This full-time leadership role is crafted for a visionary and strategic leader who excels in guiding organizations towards achieving their strategic objectives, driving growth, and enhancing operational excellence across the enterprise.
Role Summary:The CEO will serve as the driving force behind the company's strategic direction, growth initiatives, and overall operational performance. This position demands a leader who is not only adept at identifying and capitalizing on market opportunities but also skilled in motivating a team, fostering innovation, and leading the company through periods of change. The successful candidate will embody the company's values, mission, and vision, working closely with the Board of Directors and executive leadership team to ensure the company's short-term actions align with its long-term objectives.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and execute a strategic plan to advance the company's mission and objectives, promoting revenue, profitability, and growth as an organization.Oversee the company's operations, ensuring the execution of the strategic plan through the management of day-to-day operations and organizational performance.Cultivate a strong and transparent working relationship with the Board of Directors and ensure open communication about the measurement of financial, operational, and impact performance against stated milestones and goals.Drive the company's development, focusing on strategic planning, business development, and fiscal operations.Establish and promote a positive, inclusive, and collaborative work environment that attracts, retains, and motivates top-quality personnel.Engage with customers, business partners, and external entities to strengthen the company's profile, market presence, and strategic partnerships.Ensure the company's compliance with all legal and regulatory requirements.Represent the company at various community and/or business meetings to promote the company's mission, vision, and values.Qualifications:Proven track record as a CEO or in a senior executive role within a complex organization, demonstrating the ability to navigate through change and drive organizational success.Strong understanding and experience in business fundamentals, strategic planning, and business development.Demonstrated ability to develop profitable strategies and implement the company vision.Excellent leadership, negotiation, and public speaking skills.Ability to foster a culture of transparency, integrity, and accountability.Deep understanding of financial strategies and finance-related performance metrics.Strong aptitude for decision-making and problem-solving in high-pressure environments.Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related field; MBA or relevant graduate degree strongly preferred.Benefits:Competitive executive compensation package, including an attractive base salary, bonuses, and equity options.Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance packages.Retirement savings plan with company match.Generous vacation and personal leave policies.Leadership development and continuous learning opportunities.A unique opportunity to lead and shape the future of a dynamic organization with a commitment to innovation and excellence.
East 57th Street Partners is on a mission to find a CEO who will significantly impact our client's future, driving strategic initiatives and leading the organization towards achieving its full potential. This role is perfect for a strategic thinker with a passion for leadership, innovation, and growth.

title: Solutions Sales Consultant
description:
About the role:Medisolv is seeking a high energy and extremely motivated Healthcare Information Technology Sales Solutions Consultant to support the company’s sales efforts. The company is uniquely positioned for rapid growth in quality management and value-based care and is growing the direct sales team to help capitalize on growth potential.
As a Sales Solutions Consultant at Medisolv, you will have the opportunity to play an integral role in the expansion of our business by providing solution expertise to current and prospective clients during the sales process. Key activities include performing solution and platform level demonstrations, leading scripted demonstrations, participating in tradeshows, supporting business development initiatives, assisting with sales proposal development, staying current on solution roadmap new releases and key features, and maintaining the presentation database.
Responsibilities: solution expertise to current and prospective clients during the sales process, working collaboratively with the team of Sales Executives.solution and platform-level demonstrations, providing product-level expertise and addressing questions from prospective clients and partners.understanding of clients’ requirements and assist in building out strategy and value proposition to address clients’ need through the company’s solutions, capabilities and services.marketing team by providing solution videos, photos, and materials for promotional campaigns.with internal product management, engineering, and client services teams to stay current on solution roadmaps, new releases and key features, and best practices for implementation and services.the presentation database and perform regular updates to content/build necessary to deliver thorough demonstrations and support any scripted presentations.an understanding of strategic selling and complex sales process.the sales team in achieving agreed-upon sales goals.participate in professional trade shows, associations, and other events to generate new business.and build relationships with Medisolv business partners and other organizations.the company’s CRM system for documenting relevant updates.regular feedback from the field regarding competitive intelligence and considerations for platform/solution enhancements.participate as a member of the sales and marketing departments in supporting development of new tools, strategies, plans, etc. for growing top line.a deep understanding of the company’s solutions and their unique value proposition for clients.internal projects or growth-related initiatives, as needed.
Required Qualifications: degree or associate degree with equivalent experience.of 10 years of progressive experience in the healthcare information technology industry.communication and presentation skills of product features and key functionality with attention to detail. Current experience presenting healthcare technology products and solutions to C-level executives and other senior executives within hospitals and health system market or large-scale ambulatory market.Experience can be in professional services/consulting, product management, direct sales, or sales support roles.knowledge of quality management, and/or advanced analytics solutions.independent and resourceful self-starter with highly motivated demeanor.strong sense of personal accountability to drive business results and exceed expectations.to establish strong team relationships and thrive in a highly collaborative environment.a remote position with travel to support tradeshows and industry events, with occasional on-site client meetings and internal company meetings. (Ability to travel approximately 25%.)with Microsoft 365 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.), CRM solutions (HubSpot), video conferencing/presentation solutions (Zoom, Teams, GoToMeeting, etc.).completion of a pre-employment background checkbe legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer. We are unable to provide sponsorship at this time.
Preferred Qualifications: knowledge of CMS quality reporting regulations and requirements.Nursing background or equivalent experience.with HCIT solutions delivered in a hosted or SaaS deployment model, including high-level technical architecture.with data science and business intelligence.
This position is open to remote work. Our office is located in Columbia, Maryland.
Who are we?Medisolv helps healthcare organizations improve patient care by providing the data they need to evaluate their organizations’ performance. Medisolv developed a healthcare quality management platform that gathers data from an organization’s EHR which is used to calculate measure performance. We pair our software with award-winning support to organizations attempting to navigate the complex field of regulatory reporting.
Medisolv's clients include over 1,600 hospitals & 6,000 providers. We’ve supported our clients for nearly 25 years & were the first in the field of electronic measurement for many seminal federal requirements. Our advisors dissect federal rulings to ensure hospitals & clinics are correctly meeting their requirements. Medisolv then submits this data to governing bodies.
We are a Great Place to Work® Certified company. With us, you can expect an environment where employees feel motivated, challenged, and encouraged. Our office is located in Columbia, MD and have employees working remotely in 33 states. Our team understands work life balance and that we have a life beyond our desks. At Medisolv, we work with passion, excellence, integrity and innovation.

title: ASSISTANT PROFESSOR - ORGANIZATIONAL BEHAVIOR/HUMAN RESOURCES
company_name: University of Vermont Grossman School of Business
description:
The University of Vermont’s Grossman School of Business (GSB) invites applications for an Assistant Professor in organizational behavior (OB) AND/OR human resource management (HRM). This will be a full-time, tenure-track appointment with a flexible start date no later than August 2025. Candidates with an exemplary record of accomplishments in research and teaching may be offered discretionary research and professional development funds through the Barbara R. McIntosh Professorship.
Our ideal candidate will be a graduate of an AACSB-accredited program OR an advanced Assistant Professor. The candidate must be granted a doctorate in OB, HRM or a related discipline (e.g., Management, Organization Studies, or Industrial & Organizational Psychology) prior to their intended start date. They should show ability and enthusiasm to (1) publish high quality research (e.g., FT50 or ABS 4 & 4*); (2) teach a 2/2 load at undergraduate and graduate levels, with preps in OB and HRM; and (3) contribute to extracurricular, experiential initiatives. While in the tenure track, candidates should consistently demonstrate a potential to build the research reputation of the GSB, develop compelling courses, and inspire students both inside and outside the classroom. In support of these contributions, this position offers AACSB competitive salary and benefits. In line with our commitment to transparency, the UVM Office of Institutional Research and Assessment regularly compiles a base pay list for paid university positions, as well as detailed breakdowns of faculty and staff by occupation, full/part-time status, tenure track status, unit, sex, race/ethnicity, and more.  The Grossman School of Business is AACSB accredited and employs 30 tenured and tenure-track faculty from multiple disciplines, as well as very experienced, professionally qualified, non-tenure-track faculty. Our faculty collaborate in their teaching and research within the GSB and with faculty in other UVM colleges and schools, fostering a culture of support and encouragement for junior faculty in their research and teaching. Senior faculty members are enthusiastic mentors who regularly publish in and hold editorships and editorial board appointments at top-tier journals such as Academy of Management Journal, Administrative Science Quarterly, Journal of Applied Psychology, Journal of Business Ethics, Journal of Management, Journal of Management Studies, Organization Studies, Strategic Management Journal, among many others.  Our undergraduate degree program provides a distinctive focus on three interdisciplinary themes: Global Business, Sustainable Business, and Entrepreneurship. The GSB has two remarkably successful graduate programs: the Sustainable Innovation MBA (SI-MBA) and the Master of Accountancy (MAcc). The SI-MBA program has consistently been named as a Top Green MBA by Princeton Review, most recently ranking #2 in 2021, 2022 and 2023, and ranking #1 in 2018, 2019 and 2020. The GSB is also known for hosting the annual Schlesinger Global Family Enterprise Case Competition (SG-FECC), where students from across the globe leverage expertise they have developed in the classroom towards solving complex family business cases. Candidates should be open to teaching in both the undergraduate and the graduate programs based on the school's needs.
About UVM Since 1791, the University of Vermont has worked to move humankind forward. Today, UVM is a Public Ivy and top-100 research university of a perfect size - large enough to offer a breadth of ideas, resources, and opportunities, yet small enough to enable close faculty-student mentorship across all levels of study, from bachelor’s to M.D. and Ph.D. programs. It distinguishes itself from other universities not only through the quality and rigor of its programs but through its commitment to a thriving future for people and planet - where discovery, creativity, community, and action coalesce to secure a healthier, greener tomorrow. Here, students’ educational experience and activities are enriched by our location — from the energy and innovation of Burlington to the forests, farms, and self-reliant spirit of Vermont. UVM gives students endless ways to explore the world, challenge ideas, and dig in on the most pressing social, environmental, and economic issues of our time. 
About Burlington The University is in Burlington, Vermont, and enjoys a panoramic setting on the shores of Lake Champlain, between the Green Mountains of Vermont and the Adirondack Mountains of New York. Our idyllic small college town perennially appears on national rankings that laud its livability, access to nature and outdoor recreation (including the best boating and skiing in the northeast), thriving food and music scene, rising identity as a technology and innovation hub, and its status as a top college town. Burlington’s nickname, BTV, comes from the code for its international airport, just 10 minutes from campus. With Montreal a 90-minute and Boston a 3.5-hour drive away, international and metropolitan culture are easily accessible for weekend adventures.  Working at UVM This exceptional institution in an unparalleled location attracts top minds and talented professionals. At UVM, you will join colleagues committed to excellence in their field, diversity and inclusion, ethical conduct, and working together to advance the University of Vermont’s mission to create and share knowledge and educate accountable leaders for humankind. 
The University of Vermont is especially interested in candidates who can contribute to the diversity and inclusive excellence of the academic community through their teaching, service and research, scholarship or creative arts. We are an educationally purposeful community looking to prepare students to be accountable leaders in a diverse and changing world. Members of the University of Vermont community embrace and advance the values of Our Common Ground: Openness, Respect, Responsibility, Integrity, Innovation, and Justice. The successful candidate will show a strong commitment to the ideals of accessibility, inclusiveness, and academic excellence as reflected in the tenets of Our Common Ground. Application ProcessApplications must be submitted through the UVM website www.uvmjobs.com (Post#F3031PO). The application package should include a cover letter outlining one’s fit with the position and the Grossman School of Business, a current curriculum vitae, a statement of research interests and plans, a statement of teaching interests and experience, evidence of teaching effectiveness, and contact information for at least three references. Importantly, applicants should include a separate statement addressing your commitment to advancing diversity and inclusive excellence. Applicants with inquiries may contact the Search Committee Chair, Dr. Felipe Massa at felipe.massa@uvm.edu. 
Review of applications will begin in July of 2024 and continue until a subset of applicants are selected for remote interviews. Finalists will be invited to give job talks and meet the faculty, staff, and students on campus. 
The University of Vermont is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category legally protected by federal or state law.

title: Seller Consultant, Sales + Service (FL)
description:
About The Team

Selling homes is a complicated process with uncertain timelines. The Seller Consultant team is passionate about changing that. We interact and support sellers to improve their experience, tailoring our approach to meet each customer where they are at in the process. Our team is responsible for delivering an outstanding consumer experience and tapping into our expertise to get every customer moving in unlocking their next chapter. We are central to the B2C mission of integrating offerings across the Zillow platform, making it easier for customers to sell their homes.

About The Role

Are you a high-energy team-player with excellent organization and interpersonal skills? Are you motivated to achieve and exceed monthly targets on a consistent basis while providing outstanding service? The Seller Consultant is a highly sociable individual who plays an instrumental role in revolutionizing the way consumers connect with Zillow products and Real Estate professionals. You will be engaged in our dynamic environment and expected to live Zillow Group’s Core Values. If you are ready to work hard, learn, and be challenged to grow and improve- we look forward to talking with you soon.

This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.

In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.

Who you are

Ability to thrive in a team environment, excited to share new insights to help the team grow and succeed. Internally motivated to achieve results, and you pride yourself on continuous improvement in your work. Believe in the principle that crafting strong rapport with customers and colleagues alike is essential to long-term success. Obsessed with creating an incredible experience for your customer, acknowledging and sharing barriers that get in the way. Understand that process matters, and follow SOPs to ensure consistency in the customer experience. 

Responsibilities

Responsible for handling inbound and outbound calls and written tasks for customers looking to sell and potentially buy homes. Directly contact sellers to discover their needs and offer solutions using Zillow’s products and services. Help customers navigate obstacles with exceptional communication skills, providing a consultative experience. Get customers connected to the right Zillow products (a local Premier Agent partner, OpenDoor for a cash offer, or to ZHL for information on financing their new home after they’ve sold their existing one!) through an understanding of real estate and a dedication to creating a best-in-class consumer experience. Deliver an extraordinary customer experience and establish relationships with your customers that create the optimal environment for transactions to occur. Drive accountability for yourself and your team through proactive engagement with your results and active involvement in team discussions and initiatives. Ensure compliance to real estate norms, policies, and regulations to the highest degree. Possess an understanding of the real estate business to be able to accurately identify customers’ priorities and guide them to the right offerings to fit their needs. Ability to navigate ambiguity and respond to changes in the business with agility

Qualifications

Active real estate license(s) and/or willingness to acquire licensing in multiple (maximum: 5) states1-2 years experience in a customer-facing role1+ years of sales/demand generation experienceMust be comfortable conducting both engaging and authentic inbound and outbound sales calls and skilled in discovery, handling initial reluctance, and objection handling. Ability to storytell and provide recommendations to sellers that meet their needs through establishing trust in Zillow products. Must possess excellent communication skills, knowing how to actively listen and use objections as a space to ask more questions. Must be able to interact with 3rd party stakeholder information and processes with integrity. Quick and flexible learnerExcellent problem-solving skills with a technical ability to listen and hear opportunities that lead to success for our customers. Willing to work flexible schedules that include early mornings, late nights, weekends and holidays

Get to know us

Zillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.

As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.

Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.

Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.

Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.

title: Controller
description:
Job Title: Controller for a PE-Backed Company
East 57th Street Partners is actively seeking a forward-thinking and analytical Controller on behalf of one of our esteemed clients. This pivotal role is a full-time opportunity ideally suited for a finance professional who thrives in the domains of financial oversight, strategic financial planning, and organizational leadership within a private equity-backed environment. The Controller will play an instrumental role in steering the financial strategy and ensuring the financial robustness of the company, thereby supporting sustained growth and value creation.
Role Overview:As a crucial figure within the executive leadership team, the Controller will lead the organization's financial functions, encompassing financial planning and analysis, accounting and financial reporting, treasury, and finance operations. The ideal candidate will bring a strategic perspective coupled with tangible financial expertise, demonstrating a track record of improving financial outcomes and aligning them with the company’s strategic goals.
Key Responsibilities:Spearhead the development and implementation of the company’s financial strategy, ensuring it is in harmony with the overarching strategic aims of the business.Guide the finance team in all facets of financial management, including budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, and managing investments.Offer strategic financial insights and leadership on pivotal decision-making issues impacting the company, such as potential mergers, acquisitions, and other investment opportunities.Uphold the finance group's integrity through the provision of timely, precise analysis of budgets, financial trends, and forecasts.Establish and uphold internal control systems to protect the organization’s financial assets, while ensuring compliance with all financial regulations and standards.Collaborate closely with the executive team to provide advice on financial implications of business operations and strategy.Maintain relationships with banks, investors, and external financial analysts.Oversee the capital structure of the company, identifying the optimal mix of debt, equity, and internal funding to facilitate the company’s growth and stability.Qualifications:Extensive experience in a Controller role, or similar, within a complex organization, showcasing a successful history of financial management and leadership.Deep understanding of corporate financial laws, risk management practices, and private equity operations.Proficient in financial analysis, forecasting, and financial management software (e.g., ERP systems).Strategic thinker with a keen analytical mindset, capable of broad consideration of the business’s financial needs.Exceptional organizational, leadership, and communication skills.BSc/BA in Accounting, Finance, or a relevant field; MSc/MBA or relevant certifications (e.g., CPA or CFA) highly regarded.Benefits:Competitive compensation package, including performance incentives and equity participation.Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.Retirement plan with company matching contributions.Generous vacation and personal leave entitlements.Extensive opportunities for professional growth and development within a dynamic and supportive work setting.
East 57th Street Partners is committed to finding a Controller who will make a substantial impact on our client's financial health and strategic initiatives. This position is an excellent match for a financial leader dedicated to catalyzing change, inspiring innovation, and amplifying financial performance across the company.

title: Senior Financial Planning & Analysis (Sr. FP&A) Analyst
description:
Position: Senior Financial Planning & Analysis (Sr. FP&A) Analyst
About Us:East 57th Street Partners is a distinguished consultancy and executive search firm, committed to connecting our clients with top-tier financial and strategic talent. Currently, on behalf of our client, a leading company renowned for its innovation and growth within its industry, we are seeking an experienced and proactive Senior FP&A Analyst. This role is instrumental in supporting strategic decision-making through comprehensive financial analysis, forecasting, and budgeting.
Role Overview:The Senior FP&A Analyst will be a key player in the finance team, responsible for providing analytical support to guide the company's financial planning and business strategy. This includes developing financial models, conducting variance analysis, and presenting insights to support business decisions. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical background, excellent communication skills, and a strategic mindset.
Key Responsibilities:Lead the development and execution of the annual budget, quarterly forecasts, and long-term financial plans.Conduct thorough financial analysis to identify trends, risks, and opportunities, and present actionable insights to senior management.Develop and maintain sophisticated financial models to support decision-making regarding capital investments, pricing strategies, and growth initiatives.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather accurate financial information and business intelligence.Monitor and report on financial performance, including variance analysis against budget and forecast, providing detailed explanations for deviations.Drive continuous improvement in financial reporting processes, systems, and tools to enhance efficiency and accuracy.Support the preparation of presentations and financial reports for the executive team, board of directors, and external stakeholders.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. An MBA or professional certification (e.g., CPA, CFA) is preferred.Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in financial planning and analysis, accounting, or a related financial role, preferably within the same industry.Expertise in financial modeling, budgeting, and forecasting with a strong understanding of GAAP.Proficient in MS Excel and financial planning software (e.g., Hyperion, SAP BPC, Adaptive Insights).Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to distill complex data into clear, concise insights.Strong communication and interpersonal skills, capable of working collaboratively across teams and influencing senior leadership.Detail-oriented, with excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

title: Director of Customer Success
description:
At our client, we are seeking an experienced Director of Customer Success to spearhead their CS Operations team. As a seasoned player/coach, you will guide, develop, and mentor a talented team towards achieving success. Be part of the journey in fostering continuous internal improvement and delivering optimized experiences for our client's valued customers.
Key Responsibilities:Lead the definition, execution, and monitoring of strategic and operational programs to successful fruition.Drive the development and execution of diverse Customer Success initiatives, often collaborating cross-functionally, aimed at enhancing the effectiveness and adoption capabilities of our customers on our platform. These initiatives encompass customer journey refinement, health scoring, and the introduction of new playbooks.Utilize data and analytics from Salesforce and Looker to lead, develop, and evaluate outcomes for Customer Success Managers regarding adoption-centric initiatives, programs, and campaigns.Enhance the efficiency of Customer Success Manager workflows.Foster the Customer Success partnership with the Platform by conveying the "voice of the customer" to Product teams. This involves fostering interdepartmental collaboration, establishing reporting mechanisms, defining metrics, and facilitating customer engagement through various means such as surveys and interviews.
Qualifications:Demonstrated progressive experience in Customer Success Operations within a SaaS company, preferably with clientele from Government and Corporate sectors. Prior experience in Customer Success before transitioning to Operations is advantageous.Proficiency in leveraging the capabilities of the Salesforce suite, CS-focused platforms (e.g., Gainsight), and Corporate Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Looker).Proven track record of leading cross-functional initiatives within mid-sized organizations (e.g., 400+ employees).Leadership experience managing a team of at least 3 members, with a willingness to adopt a player/coach role.Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively articulate and convey strategies and plans.Demonstrated success in coordinating cross-functional efforts, encompassing planning, execution tracking, decision-making, and OKR management.
10xCompanyJobs tracks jobs at a curated list of companies that have the potential to 10x their value.

title: Director of Finance And Accounting
description:

On behalf of our client, a forward-thinking company renowned for its innovative approach and market leadership, we are in search of an experienced Director of Finance. title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
description:

title: Floating Universal Banker
description:
Leader Bank is looking for exceptionally dedicated team members to join one of the region’s fastest growing community banks and mortgage lenders. At the time of its founding in 2002, Leader Bank had one branch office, $6.5 million in assets and 7 team members. Since then, the Bank has become of the most successful banks in Massachusetts with more than $4 billion in assets, more than 400 team members, 7 branch offices, and annual mortgage originations of over $5 billion.
Exemplary products and an innovative spirit have driven Leader Bank’s rapid growth over the years, and our team members embrace these values. Our mission is to obsess over our clients, make them feel valued, and maintain long-term relationships with them by constantly enhancing our products and processes to always be improving our client experience. For our team members, Leader Bank prioritizes competitive compensation and benefits, a healthy work-life balance, and an environment that fosters diversity and inclusion.
The Floating Universal Banker will be assigned to any of the Leader Bank branch locations in the Greater Boston Area as needed, including Arlington Heights, East Arlington, Belmont, and Burlington.

Essential Duties
Maintains a high level of understanding of all products and services provided by the Bank.Maintains a high level of service quality by acknowledging the customer’s presence through a professional greeting and developing an interpersonal relationship built upon an understanding of customer needs. Conveys to customers an eagerness / willingness to help.Performs as a teller including performing financial transactions with Bank customers and settlement procedures and balances cash drawer, as needed.Meets customer needs through problem solving techniques as required.Sells and refers Bank products and services within the guidelines established by the Bank. Follows up with prospects by asking for their business. Maintains referral documentation and actively participates in sales promotions.Conducts business in a professional manner and maintains a neat and orderly work area.Establishes and maintains a good working relationship with all Bank team members.Participates in community projects and organizations as requested. Demonstrates a willingness to accept added duties and responsibilities.Performs all banking transactions, including opening accounts, checking & savings deposits, IRA’s, business retirement accounts, and various types of payments, in accordance with Bank policy.Understands and adheres to security, compliance, and retail banking policies and procedures.Comply with all aspects of the Bank Secrecy Act responsibilities include accurately completing Currency Transaction Reports (CTRs), adhering to the Customer Identification Program (CIP) Policy, reporting suspicious activity to your manager, and performing Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) checks.Performs other duties as may be required from time to time by management. 
Qualifications Include
High School Diploma or equivalentA minimum of two years retail banking experience or retail sales and service experienceStrong interpersonal skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsGeneral personal computer knowledge, prior experience banking applications preferredAbility to handle multiple priorities and poses a strong attention to detailSales and service oriented personalityMust be available to work Saturdays and evenings on a rotating basis 
Leader Bank offers an excellent compensation and benefits package including: 401k plan with corporate match, medical and dental insurance, and the opportunity to work for a fast growing, local organization.
Leader Bank, N.A. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, military status, veteran status or any other protected class.

title: Life Enrichment Coordinator
description:
Are you looking for opportunities for professional development and growth within a nonprofit organization? Midland Care is now hiring for a Life Enrichment Coordinator.

Summary

As a Life Enrichment Coordinator, you will be responsible for developing and implementing engaging programs and activities for individuals in our community to enhance their physical, social, emotional, and intellectual well-being. You will work closely with participants, families, and staff to create a vibrant and fulfilling lifestyle.

Midland Care’s Program of All-inclusive Care for the Elderly (PACE) is a not-for-profit health care program that helps people at risk for needing nursing home care who meet a level of care requirement stay in their own homes and communities.

For Midland Care PACE participants, PACE means a team of experienced doctors, nurses and other health care professionals getting to know the participant and working with him or her to design a plan to aid in achieving health goals.

Employment Status: Full-time | Monday - Friday, 8am - 5pm

Starting Pay: $20.00/hour (pay is based on experience and requirements of role)

Duties

Provides orientation and education to staff/volunteers.Fulfills administrative requirements including timely completion of evaluations/reassessments, charting, and maintaining records.Actively participates in the interdisciplinary team meetings, communicating participant changes to the team as treatment plans are developed.Ensure activities are documented in the medical record.Treats all people with respect; maintains confidentiality and strives toward service excellence.Provides full range, direct supervision to other positions as listed elsewhere on this Job Description. Makes recommendations to higher level authority that carry particular weight with regard to employment actions including hiring, discipline, pay increases/decreases and termination. Provides guidance, direction, feedback, counsel and training to subordinate staff as needed. Completes annual reviews in a timely manner. Reviews and approves/denies requests for time off. Utilizes Midland Care’s progressive discipline process as needed.

Benefits

Health, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug PlansEmployee Assistance ProgramPTO, Personal Days, Taking Care of You Days6 paid holidays403b with matchFree group life and AD&D Life Insurance of $20,000Company discounts for regional restaurants and attractionsOn-site education center to provide professional development and CEU credits.On Demand Pay (Any day is pay day)

Qualifications

Required: One year experience working with an elderly population; interdisciplinary teamwork, ability to work effectively with culturally, economically, and educationally diverse populations, and form positive interpersonal relations in dealing with a wide range of staff and participants essential; Ability to assist with activities at home and in center. Good understanding of psychosocial problems of aging. Must possess a valid Kansas Driver’s License, in force automobile liability insurance and maintain a Motor Vehicle Record (MVR) that meets organization’s insurability standard as defined by Midland policy.

Preferred: Activities Director Certification

A culture of caring is a way of life for Midland Care. Diversity, Inclusion and Equity are more than just words. Understanding, accepting and valuing differences between people empowers us to foster the meaning of caring for our community.

Make a meaningful impact on the well-being and happiness of our participants within our community. Apply today.

title: Water Resources- H&H Project Engineer
description:
Job Description

Johnson, Mirmiran & Thompson is a dynamic, 100% employee-owned consulting firm of more than 2,000 professionals that provides a full range of multi-disciplined engineering, architecture, information technology, and related services to public agencies and private clients throughout the United States. JMT, is currently ranked #59 on Engineering News-Record’s list of the Top 500 Design Firms.

Water Resources Engineering is a core practice at JMT. We are looking to grow, adding the best and brightest to our teams. We have an exceptional team working diligently on improving a variety of infrastructure and resiliency projects throughout the Mid-Atlantic region and JMT’s vast footprint. This team is looking for a driven, nimble, resourceful, and adaptive project engineer who is looking to learn, grow, and lead.

The Project Engineer will focus on hydrology and hydraulic studies but required to perform engineering design, watershed modeling, permitting, construction support, and inspection tasks. Candidates are expected to be well-versed across the water resources discipline. Demonstrating proficiency in drainage design, grading, erosion and sediment control design, stormwater management design, hydrology, and hydraulic modeling, permitting, utility coordination and clash detection, specification development, and quantity takeoffs. U.S. Residency Required.

The successful candidate will have the opportunity for upward mobility in leading and managing tasks.

Essential Functions And Responsibilities

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Summit Polymers is a leading Tier 1 Automotive Supplier of automotive interior systems . As a world-class automotive supplier of injection molded interior trim, we specialize in the engineering, manufacturing, and assembly of feature based registers, consoles and trim panels.

 JOIN A TEAM WHERE YOU’LL BE CHALLENGED AND valued. 

A career with Summit Polymers means working with smart people in a culture that thrives on challenging, meaningful work. At Summit, we look for growth potential with every hire. We don’t just fill seats, we set people on career paths. We’re always on the lookout for smart people who are committed to continuous improvement, customer service and quality.

Summary

The Maintenance Technician is a skilled journeyman responsible for installing, performing preventive maintenance, troubleshooting and repairing equipment dealing with hydraulic, electrical and mechanical systems within an injection molding manufacturing facility. Equipment includes injection molding machines and auxiliary equipment, process water systems, compressed air systems and automated paint lines.

Responsibilities And Duties

 Mentoring and Monitoring Apprentice Correcting safety issues involving equipment and facilities Performing preventative maintenance on equipment on systems such as injection molding machines, paint lines and process water systems Using Knowledge gained through education and experience to troubleshoot and perform problem solving equipment throughout the manufacturing facility leading to root cause corrective actions and repairs. Installing, performing preventive maintenance, troubleshooting and repairing hydraulic, electrical and mechanical equipment


Education And Experience

High School Diploma or GED required, Journeyman card preferred

A minimum of 2 years of related experience in a manufacturing environment required

Basic understanding Electrical, Hydraulic and/or Mechanical systems required

Experience with troubleshooting and repairing Electrical, Hydraulic and Mechanical systems preferred

Skills And Abilities

Possesses the ability to gather and analyze information and make decisions from a limited number of choices.

 A minimum score of 20 on the Wonderlic Contemporary Cognitive Ability Test.


Travel Requirements

This position typically does not require any travel.

DISCLAIMER

The information contained in this job description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. Agreement to complete all post-hire required training.

title: Product Marketing Specialist
description:
About The Team

We’re adapting quickly, defining the future of real estate, and need your help to get there! The Product Marketing Team sits at the center of understanding customer and partner needs, and translates those needs to support Zillow’s lines of business’. Whether you’re supporting Zillow Premier Agent, Zillow Home Loans, Zillow Rentals or Zillow’s Site and App, you’ll be working to help shoppers realize their dream of getting into a home they love.

We are passionate about our customers and work cross-functionally to deliver value to our product and business partners. We help ensure that home buyers, sellers, renters and homeowners are able to find their home, while also delivering value to our business partners by empowering them with groundbreaking tools to bring value to their own brands, clients and prospective buyers.

About The Role

As a Product Marketer at Zillow, you deeply understand our customers. Armed with this understanding, you’ll partner with our product teams to ensure we build the right solutions that help our customers through one of the most important transactions in their lives, driving our business forward. You will be responsible for delivering customer and business value to our product and business partners. You’ll do this through developing coordinated marketing strategies motivated by customer insights. And you’ll partner with PMs to develop products and roadmaps, craft value propositions, and partner with channel and comms strategy teams, to bring your strategies to life, all while representing them to senior collaborators and working closely with the business to drive impact.

Key Responsibilities:

Partner with the Insights team to develop meaningful findings about defined personas in our business through qualitative and quantitative research. Develop messaging, positioning, and core value proposition for one or more product lines. Use insights, competitors, and the market as the voice of the customer in business, product, and marketing decisions. Work closely with the product and business strategy teams to educate both internal and external audiences about product features and their benefits. Define marketing strategies to support our customers and grow our business. Partner with channel owners to drive and execute integrated go-to-market campaigns that deliver on those strategies. Drive and/or support the creation of marketing assets e.g, emails, videos, ads, web pages, etc. that will grow the business. Support the delivery of key business metrics measured against company OKRs. Support strategic business briefs to empower the cross-functional marketing team to drive your business

This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice, which must be identified to the Company. U.S. employees may live in any of the 50 United States, with limited exceptions.

In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $98,600.00 - $157,400.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.

In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.

Who you are

You are customer-centric, data-driven, and a keen problem solver. You are a motivator and a communicator. You have worked closely with product teams from the moment of inception for a new product through launch. You have defined the strategies that moved a vision to market and briefed-in agencies, creative partners, and channel marketing teams. You are both creative and exacting, capable of focusing on the big picture as you are of nailing the details. Most importantly, you identify and address the right problems and are a creative mind who wants to be a part of a company leading a movement to re-imagine how we buy, rent and sell homes.

At least 4 years in product marketing or similar experience. Ability to deeply understand customer needs and develop insights that shape marketing plans and influence product roadmap. A strong sense of initiative and follow-through. Strong strategic problem solver, with a high level of curiosity and an insight backed approach. Ability to analyze opportunities, define objectives and drive desired outcomes. Ability to build strong working relationships across teams, lead through influence, and drive decisions through compelling data and communication. Experience working with product and business teams in a fast-paced technology company. Confident communicator, with excellent oral and written communication skills. Comfortable managing through ambiguity and leading flexible, agile, go-to-market tests as a means to identify stable strategies and tactics. 

Transferable Skills

Here at Zillow - we value the experience and perspective of candidates with non-traditional backgrounds. Do you have transferable skills or related experiences? We encourage you to apply!

Get to know us

Zillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.

As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.

Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.

Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.

Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.

title: Interim Chief Financial Officer
description:
Interim Chief Financial Officer (CFO) 
East 57th Street Partners is proud to partner with our client, a leading and innovative company, in their search for an Interim Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Our client is committed to maintaining excellence and agility in their operations, supporting a flexible work environment conducive to balancing professional growth and personal well-being. In this pivotal period of transition and growth, we seek a strategic interim leader to steer our client's financial and operational strategies.
